Reviews.Title: “Conference in hotel Catalonia Berna”
Reviews.Author: Vedrana_Belgrade
Reviews.Content: This is not a four star hotel. The only good thing about this hotel is its location. It is a bit overpriced and rooms need refurbishing. Air condition was not working, and the closet door were broken. Nevertheless, rooms are clean and tidy. Stuff is not well organized, you spend a lot of time waiting for check in/out. Breakfast was also below expectations. This hotel should be considered as three star hotel with excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “General comments”
Reviews.Author: jack a Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In general the hotel was good.Apart from the fact that the fridge did not work for the first three days of the four we stayed,despite several reporting. There are no kettles in the rooms which I thought was rather odd as having stayed in all types of hotels,they all provided tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. The rooms were a good size and very clean and the staff were very obliging.The location is excellent and very close to all aminities and subway.Value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, perfectly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: dunkershall
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. We where upgraded to top floor with terass and spectacular view over the city. Very good service. Great breakfast. We had a business dinner at the hotel, which was quite nice (about 10000 times as nice as the next nights dinner at W! Don't eat there!)

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: 977Sandy
Reviews.Content: I really did not expect much from Barcelona or its people ... everyone talks so much that I thought they would be conceited... But I tell you they´re the nicest people of all Spain!! And the Catalonia Berna is the greatest hotel of all the 6 I´ve stayed at on this trip. Do go there!

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm”
Reviews.Author: Mickgas
Reviews.Content: Ok place. Don't know how it's a for star with only a small bar and no other amenities. A bit pricy. € 16 for a breakfast that's worth about €6. Good location though

Reviews.Title: “Central and cosy”
Reviews.Author: GREEKSTORYTELLER
Reviews.Content: Cosy hotel,recommended,enough space in rooms,breakfast very good and service ok.Its an ideal hotel for visiting Barcelona but I booked this hotel through Travel agency package thus, I am not sure of the price if you travel alone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AJ-May
Reviews.Content: My wife booked here for 4 nights for my 40th Birthday as a surprise. We were made to feel very welcome when we arrived, the staff were friendly and very helpful. We were given a room with a very spacious terrace. The room was exceptionally clean and tastefully decorated. The bathroom was also spotless with an assortment of complimentary sundries. We didn't take breakfast in the hotel, we found a small place a couple of blocks away that suited our needs. Catalonia Berna was in a nice location, most places within walking distance, but buses or metro were nearby if you were tired of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing night”
Reviews.Author: Sonia M
Reviews.Content: I just spent one night at your hotel, having some fun in Barcelona. Great location only 10 minutes from Passeig de Gracia. Confortable rooms, modern and very clean. Breakfast included is delicious. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, especially the general manager. I would highly recommend it for sure! P.S.: I love your elevator!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the L'Eixample area”
Reviews.Author: AuntAnnie
Reviews.Content: Like the Hotel Catalonia Gran Via in Madrid (part of same chain), this hotel seemed to cater mainly to groups. Stayed 6 ngihts starting October 8th as part of a Road Scholar trip, Location was great, especially if you learn the metro (subway) and bus systems - subway was very easy to learn only I did get turned around at the exits The hotel is within walking distance of Gudi's Casa Mila and about a 20 minute walk from the Sagrad Familia. It's also fun to leisurely walk from the Columbus Monument on La Rambla up to Plaza de Catalunya. Be sure to stop and rest at a cafe. Paseo de Gracia is only 3 blocks away and has lots of shops and restaurants. I had a corner room, which I loved, but there is city noise if you open the windows. There was only one night when the air conditioning was down for the whole hotel and one night when the phone service was out for awhile. The neighborhood is very nice and it was fun to walk to the shops at the corner of Valencia - bakery, cheese, wine, flower shop. Also a convenience store just around the corner. There's a school almost next door and when the kids got out, it reminded me a lot of the Upper East Side in NYC. Service at the bar seemed very spotty. Three of us wanted a drink before dinner one night and no one was there until another group came in. Suddenly a bartender appeared.. The main disadvantage was that CNN did not come in in my room. Most people in our group did get it and every day I was told that it would be looked at - even when the next day was that person's day off. Never did get CNN,

Reviews.Title: “Averag Stay, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ayman Z
Reviews.Content: Catalonia Berna hotel experience for me was average of just above average experience. Mainly it's nice place as a starting point for going out all the day and get back at the end of the day for spending the night. As spending any time in the hotel is not very good experience. The rooms are limited in space, yet, clean. The view is on the internal hotel space, and the breakfast buffet is not bad. The staff at the hotel reception is nice, and friendly. The location of the hotel is average, it's not far from Catalonia Square, the main destination for many activities, however, it's not very near also, it takes from 15-20 minutes walking and for me, with a child, it was daily discomfort in going out and getting back. One of the major negative points is that they charge you for using the safety deposit box in your room, something I did not ever experience in any other hotel. This was very annoying for me, as the choice is that either to pay additional fees, or the hotel will have no responsibility for valuable items on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: Finnegan101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, and the staff is very good. The breakfast buffet (at 16.00E it better be), was excellent! The rooms are OK, but the bed was literally a concrete slab. Pillows are good, linens clean.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: 31travelbug
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 week at this hotel. My husband was there for business and I went along. The location is very convenient to restaurants, shopping, and transportation. Only about 10 minutes walking distance to Placa Catalunya and 15 minutes to the Sagrada Familia. The staff was helpful and spoke English and some French. The breakfast was plentiful, healthy, and very good. Our room was very comfortable, clean and quiet and our view was of one of the inner courtyards, so no street noise. Our only problem was with one of the sliding closet doors that we had to fight with every time we opened or closed it. I can't comment on the price since the company booked and paid for our stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great Service! Great location”
Reviews.Author: michal o
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my time at this hotel! The loction was 5 minute walk from the center and metro. The room was nice and clean, the bed really comfortable, air con, mini bar, everything necessary. The staff was professinal, nice beyond any expectation, and helped me with every question, problem, and even recommended of restaurants and places to go out in the evening. Breakfast was rich and wonderful!! Would definitely go back there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, staff & service”
Reviews.Author: a l
Reviews.Content: I went there for a trade show placed in Barcelona and I stayed at this hotel. The hotel, views, terrace and staff were delightful. It was great to feel so comfortable being so far away from home. If I have to come back to Barcelona, this hotel will be for sure my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: michBirmingham
Reviews.Content: the hotel is at a great location, Very clean and the staff is very friendly and they do speak English! the breakfast is fantastic and the hotel in general is absolutely recommendable!!! will be def back there!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the center of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: erika111111111
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband we spent fantastic week in this hotel last July. Hotel is very cosy and clean. Friendly stuff, good food. Very close to the center of Barcelona, many sightseeing places around. Absolutely recomendable.

Reviews.Title: “Small ,clean and convienient”
Reviews.Author: Brainpop
Reviews.Content: We traveled with the Carnivall vacation package and was assigneed to this hotel. Although my spanish was very limited, I thought that the hotel staff at the front desk would be more conversant in English than they were, but the restaurant staff spoke very well. The room we were assigned was tiny, but clean with a nice size bathroom, tv was included. Unfortunately, we forgot out electric converter, and none was to be found in the surrounding area....the hotel had no "loaners". The hotel is well situated, being close to La Ramblas, two blocks from the Paseo de Gracia, with all the tour buses, which were GREAT for newcomers who want to see the city. The hotel is in the Exiample district, and the hotel is surrounded with many small restaurants to choose from.....there are also, ATMs, churches, and everything you really need for a great stay very near by. We had breakfast in the hotel, and it was fine, with nice white tablecloths, and a pretty decor.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Wilhelmina87
Reviews.Content: This is a well kept hotel in the Eixample district of Barceliona about 2 blocks from the Paseo de Gracia. The room was adequate, everything looked modern and there were sufficient elevators. There was a bus stop one block away and the bus service was quite good. A little further away on the Paseo de Gracia there is a Metro station. The staff was very friendly, but sometimes, especially in the evening, some of the front desk staff's English was not quite adequate to grasp non-routine matters. The only real drawback was the charge for the in-room safe, which I decided was a necessity because of the high prevalence of pick pockets in areas of Barcelona frequented by tourists. I don't recall whether there was a fitness area. I would definitely stay in this hotel again and thus I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “over priced for what it has to offer”
Reviews.Author: Orbiter007
Reviews.Content: I was there in the worst time possible with a large trade fair going on so rooms were outpriced and mostly sold out. Situated on an inside road, Roger de Lluria, it can be a bit of a walk to the nearest metro. For the price charged (around Euro 300 per night with tax), the room was tiny, spartan and there was no tea/coffee maker or iron/board available. Everything is charged extra - safe, internet etc. There is one restaurant with the hotel and the food options are limited but good - though a tad expensive. About 2 odd blocks from the Pg de Gracia shopping and a short distance to Plc Catalunya. Not the first choice for stay but it isn't too bad either. If you book early enough and avail a good room rate, it may be worth staying.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vaguesondes
Reviews.Content: I felt very comfortable in this hotel from the moment I stepped through the door. The welcome at the front desk was warm without being fulsome, and the foyer was very pleasant. The room was of a good size, and comfortable and clean. The bar was pleasant, as was the restaurant, and all the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Dinner was good, and not expensive. In particular, the people on the front desk were very willing to help with general enquiries, and they organised a taxi for very early on the day of departure without any problems. The location is good, in the Eixample area, convenient to the Metro and a pleasant walk to the area of La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “A very efficient, friendly, well positioned hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sarah-inPoole
Reviews.Content: We went in a group and the hotel catered for us all well. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The staff were always onhand to help if they could. The food was good and located just a few minutes from the main streets of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but smallish room”
Reviews.Author: DavidLau
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the conclusion of our guided tour of Spain in September 2010. The main benefit of this notel is its location in the Eixample district. You are only 2 blocks away from the Passeig de Gracia, one of the most high-end shopping streets in Barcelona with some Gaudi designed buildings to boot. The room itself is smaller than the other hotels on our tour. It has the beds and a small desk with no sitting area. We had to place our luggage on the floor as there was no tables/platforms to put them. The wood paneling on the walls make the room look a little low-rent. There are dents & dings on the walls. You have to pay 5 Euros per day for the use of the safe. There is free (and fast) wifi though. The bathroom is done in creme-colored marble with green colored wood trim. The bathroom is a little stinky though. The bathroom is decent-sized unlike the bedroom. I do have to say the front-desk person was very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and safe location in a brilliant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NLjuanito
Reviews.Content: Hotel Catalonia Berna is located close to the Paseo de Gracia (Casa Batlló and Casa Milà) and only a 10 minutes walk to the Plaça de Catalunya (close to many shops and the famous La Rambla). On both locations you can easily take the Barcelona City Tour Bus, but a metro station is also nearby the hotel. The area around the hotel is very safe which is in contrast to the La Rambla area where I stayed on a previous occasion. The hotel lobby is very spacious and the reception staff is very friendly, helpful and made me feel welcome. They all speak good English and were very willing to indicate different locations (tourist attractions, shops and restaurants) on the provided free Barcelona map. My room was spacious, with all the comfort and very CLEAN!! The room has a superb bath with fresh towels, a minibar and there is free WIFI available in the room. The buffet breakfast was superb as it was very ample with plenty of fresh fruits, different kind of breads and other hot and cold choices. Overall, I would definitely stay here again due to its perfect location, kindness of staff and cleanness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Shalom22
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews we books into the Berna and we were not let down. The service ,both at the reception and dining room , was excellent as well as location and cleanliness. There is free internet reception in all rooms . Definitely recommended

Reviews.Title: “Strange customer service”
Reviews.Author: John745
Reviews.Content: They wanted to take a photocopy of my creditcard on both sides and where surprised when I confronted them with the obvious information that this was a securityrisk. The creditcard can be used to shop on the Internet if information from both sides of the card is given to anyone and the copy is left in the desk and not even shredded when you leave... Very strange service, short and unfriendly attitude. I also tried to get a snack in the evening and the hotel is about 10 blocks from any shop. Small room and for a price of 109 Euro per night, not to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasing hotel”
Reviews.Author: johanna_norris
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveller i was very happy with the hotel. Felt very safe there. It was a10 minute walk to catalunya square. The room was spotless. Very quiet at night so it was easy to get a good night's sleep. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. I would definately return to tjis hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: TelAvivBoss
Reviews.Content: Great location 5 mins from passeig de garcia. 15 mins from placa de catalonia. cosy and tidy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great service, Great experience”
Reviews.Author: g_bz2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 5 minutes from the Place de Catalunya and approximately 10 minutes from the Rambles BLV. Reception staff are friendly and helpfully, Especially the hotel general manager - taking care from the morning till evening. Modern hotel & very clean Buffet breakfast is very rich, with plenty verity of cheeses, bread, cold cut, fruits as well breakfast staffs are very friendly. In generally: I highly recommend, definitely I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, compact city location”
Reviews.Author: jppalooza
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Location is near most tourist sites, however not close to MontJuic. 2. Breakfast included is great and many different choices, and the choices change every other day. 3. CLEAN! 4. Staff at the front desk is helpful 5. Price is good Cons: 1. Rooms are small and compact 2. Do not include washcloths, large bars of soap or shampoo and conditioner 3. Must pay for the use of safe 4. No swimming pool or gym 5. Not the most elegant 6. Must pay for local calls. 7. Wifi is "high speed" but it seemed about as high speed as dial up. Remember you are in Europe, so it's like a European hotel. It is overall a great value. The TV remote didn't work sometimes. We weren't in the room much, but it was nice and clean. It is quite a walk to the beach or the watefront but it is manageable. Not really walkable to Park Guell. I did walk to La Sagrada from here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location- easy walk to Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: voljo
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a large, spacious lobby with internet access, small elevators, and average-sized rooms for a European hotel. The location on Roger de Lluria makes it easy to walk to key locations; it's a straight shot south to Bari Gothic. An excellent tapas restaurant is nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: mkennedy38
Reviews.Content: I and some stayed here during a 3 day stay in Barcelona. Check-in was easy and pleasant. Reception was so courteous they even printed us directions to a place to get some churroes. The hotel is located within walking distance of Las Ramblas and a major shopping center. The hotel’s lounge was well decorated and served some the beat Sangria I have ever had. Our room was spacious, clean, tidy, and well stocked. The bathroom was also large. The hotel accommodated three female in one room well. The breakfast was quite good. It offered a complete omelets bar with numerous hot options. I defiantly stay again and would recommend to any struggling traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to better”
Reviews.Author: PhilFog
Reviews.Content: Situated just a few blocks from the central Placa de Catalunya, the hotel Catalonia Berna is ideally located away from the main bustle but within easy walking distance from most of the main tourist attractions including the celebrated Ramblas and La Sagrada Familia. Although perched on the corner of two fairly busy streets, the impressively efficient double glazing guaranteed a peaceful room and an undisturbed night's sleep. The room was spacious, well-maintained, with simple modern furnishings. With temperatures dropping to near zero in January the central heating was very effective. Worth noting is the fact that twin bedded rooms are available, unlike many neighbouring hotels that only provide double beds. Breakfast in the modern, bright and airy dining room comprised a broad international choice from a buffet complemented by a variety of local flavours, including spicy sausages and tortillas cooked to order. The staff, in particular those at reception and in the dining room, were welcoming, friendly and keen to be helpful. All in all, for a short city break in Barcelona, the Berna is hard to better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent situation but...”
Reviews.Author: melodie06
Reviews.Content: Good aspects of this hotel : 1. very close to the famous Passeig Gracia and you can also walk around to see beauties of the architecture 2. they have a car park just under the hotel building and you can access your room via the lift direct from the underground car park. We paid 19 euros for 24h00 3. although the buffet breakfast was included in my booking via Expedia, we could have the breakfast delivered in the room without extra cost 4. very clean room and bathroom, good light and excellent insulation to prevent from the traffic noise (two double glazed windows !) Negative aspects : 1. the bed was not very good and check it, we couldn't believe what we discovered, provided the price of the room and the 4 stars category (see picture). As we were there for just one night we didn't want to move when discovered that at night just before going to bed so we informed the hotel when checking out. I don't know if that will be changed but they didn't seem to really care. No discount, no excuses, no nothing. 2. at 2.30 am we woke up because someone was trying to enter the room and bang the door several times. I call the reception, in the meantime the person bang the door again, the hotel security came (we didn't open the door and made silence of course). And we waited, a bit anxious of course. Nothing, no news. I called reception again and the security person said "nobody there". I insisted and finally, the security admitted that he saw someone going OUT of the hotel right when he got back at reception. Scary. As a summary I would not go back for this hotel in Barcelona cause there are other options in the same area, for exemple, the Gallery Hotel where our one night stay was fantastic for an extra cost of 17 euros which were reaaaally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “nice put expensive”
Reviews.Author: Tsaraiva
Reviews.Content: Hotel Berna is a nice hotel fairly central to Barcelona, in a quiet area. The building looks great from outside with fresco painting, really pretty. Reception turn into these fashionable modern slick looks (not a fan myself) but good and clean look. Staff was ok. Professional not intrusive. Room was very nice, kind of new interior. Well isolated from the possible noises from the boulevard. Bathroom clean. On my last evening there (spent 3 nights) a staff member even came to knock on my door and gave me a chocolate. they did the same to the rest of our group staying there. Breakfast was really really good, lot of choice, tasty and plenty! On the negatives: Internet connection is really expensive. Room rate is fairly high. We got a discount as a group but still high to my eyes (would have been OK if internet connection included). A few bits and pieces to fix (nothing major: TV remote, bath extraction) but I guess it was just my room as the others were ok. Overall a very good stay. Not especially for the travellers that like the personalised contact, introduction to the culture but it was comfortable, safe and again the breakfast had a local colour and was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShawnLA_7
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a great location, service is great, rooms are nice and clean, good breakfast buffet, can't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: bradboj
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here. I booked this hotel on [--] for a four day sightseeing trip to Barca. I paid £350 for four nights (2 people) including breakfast and taxes. The hotel is in a great location only 5 minutes walk from the best shops in town. Prada, Gucci, Armani etc etc. Placa Catalonia is only 10 mins away too so that was spot on. The hotel itself was good, rooms were not very big but spotless and cleaned everyday. Lovely fresh towels and a superb bath and monsterously powewrful shower. Breakfast was superb and served 7am to 10:30am so good for early risers and those who have a few beers the night before. If you love your tea take some of your own english teabags as those served at breakfast were rubbish. We had the set menu in the restaurant one night and it was really nice. Three courses, including really fresh seafood, water, wine and bread for only 18 Euros each. We both felt it was well worth it. The only critisisms I have is that the room doors slam shut when people arrive/leave. This was particulary annoying at 6am when some people left early. Our door was the same and if you didn't control the door as you left it would slam behaind you due to not having those bracket type things that slowly close most doors. Also when I was there the air conditioning was not working in the room which got quite warm at night. I was told at reception that it does operate at this time of year. (March) I would have liked it on. The hotel is on a busy junction but the traffic noice is completely cancelled out by the double set of windows so this was not a problem. Overall, I would stay again if they sorted out the slamming doors on the 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Truand
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a wonderful 4 day break staying at the Catalonia Berna. We were a little aprehensive after reading some of the previous reviews, but found our stay to be very enjoyable. The major plus point is location, you are in walking distance of the major tourist attractions metro stations and buses, which really allow you to explore the city. Do go into Gaudi's Casa Mila which is well worth the 8 euro's We found the rooms to be spotless, cleaned daily, good size and the staff friendly and efficient. The buffet breakfast was ample and the service was good. Didn't eat in the restaurant in the evening ( does anybody) so can't comment.. One point of caution is to try and get a room facing out ward as the the inner rooms can be viewed from the glass lifts as they travel up and down which could be a bit embarassing if you forget to pull the curtains. All in all we spend majority of the holiday exploring the sites and soaking up the atmosphere. The hotel fulfilled it's function to be a pleasant place to leave your suitcase, and return for a good night sleep before setting off again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: DublinGoldwing
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel and enjoyed our stay very much. The staff were very friendly and made us feel very welcome. The room was very nice and spotless. The buffet breakfast was very impressive and all the staff there were very nice. We ate in the restaurant one night and the food was first class, the only fault was that the restaurant was very quiet but again the staff were lovely. We loved the locaton as it was only a short walk to the centre. We would have no hesitation in recommending the Catalonia Berna to our friends

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: kore12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice but the bed's are very uncomfortable and the area is very noisy. The staff are not very helpful also, do not get them to book a cab for you as the driver we had tried to rip us off by saying he had been waiting for 15 minutes. When we approached the staff to complain they did nothing to help so we had to put up with the abusive driver! I will definitely not recommend staying here, there are plenty of other hotels in Barcelona with more helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: JD134
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned to the U.K. from a four day break at the Catalonia Berna. This hotel is all you could ask for in a short break in Barcelona. The hotel was immaculately clean.Our towels were changed twice daily in our room. The room had a nice FIRM bed which suited us fine as I have a slight back problem.We were on a B&B basis and the breakfast was excellant , plenty choice, although they seemed to be training new Fillipino staff for the restuarent and they were a bit slow. We had an evening meal in the hotel one night and it was the best we had during our short stay. (A well done steak in Barcelona has blood dripping as soon as you put your knife in). The hotel is quite central, just off Passaige de Gracia and we walked to the main square, Placa de Catalunya in a few minutes. All in we enjoyed our stay and would definately go back to this hotel if we were reurning to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “a nice base from which to explore”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Catalonia Berna between Christmas and New Year 2005. I had never been to Barcelona before and was looking for a romantic trip to the city with my boyfriend. The Catalonia Berna is in a good location for exploring the city, and we walked everywhere. Breakfast was the usual continental selection, and the restaurant was clean with helpful staff. Our only problem was getting something to eat at night. We never had dinner in the restaurant as it was always closed when we went downstairs (probably because of the time of year), and you must walk to find other restaurants! The room was nice and looked brand new with a lovely marble bathroom. On our first night, water began pouring into our bathroom from upstairs, but the staff dealt with it quickly and we were moved to another room. We didn't have any English T.V. which we missed when we weren't out and about. Overall, it was a great introduction to Barcelona. I loved the city and the hotel but would probably stay closer to the main shops etc. if I was to return.

HotelInfo.Name: Catalonia Berna Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Roger de Lluria 60, 08009 Barcelona, Spain
